pr_title: PARQUET-1926: Add LogicalType support to ThriftType

timeline.message: Add ThriftSchemaConvertVisitor for INT64 logical types
Add ThriftSchemaConvertVisitor tests for INT64 logical types
Generlize thrift logicalTypeAnnotation and add more tests
PARQUET-1926: Add LogicalType support to I64Type
Add ThriftSchemaConvertVisitor tests for INT64 logical types
Generlize thrift logicalTypeAnnotation and add more tests

timeline.bodyText: Why you don't like static imports? This change (and the removing of the related import) seems to be useless.
timeline.author: gszadovszky

replies.bodyText: I find accessing these via LogicalTypeAnnotation.enumType() more clear than just enumType(). The larger change in this PR allows any thrift type to use a LogicalTypeAnnotation, so importing the class opens the door to further changes that implement these logical types.
replies.author: jmartone

replies.bodyText:
Yes, I know what this PR is about. My comment was only about this line (and the removing of the static import).
It is a matter of taste whether you like static imports or not and it is up to you if you use them or not. But modifying an existing line is another topic. I usually like to keep a change as small as possible and do not touch other code parts if it is not necessary.
Anyway, if you have a strong opinion that this change improves readability I am fine with that too.
replies.author: gszadovszky

replies.bodyText:
I remove this static import for consistency with the logical types in my changes. I do find qualifying the type with LogicalTypeAnnotation. improves readability.
If we prefer a set of discrete static imports to importing the larger class I can certainly do that instead. My motivation was more concise imports and readability.
replies.author: jmartone

replies.bodyText: I accept it as a strong opinion :)
replies.author: gszadovszky
